website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for those looking for an affordable way to give their cat freeze-dried treats.
pros: Freeze-dried chicken breast treats can be used for dogs or cats
Treats are packaged in a jar with a lid for extra protection and an easy way to keep the treats fresh
Company donates a bowl of cat or dog food to animal shelters for every jar sold
cons: Some customers noted a decrease in quality with fewer treats per jar and a harder consistency

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in lower quality of latest jar
customer_reviews.text: Shocking difference, decrease in the quality of the Halo Liv-a Little treats I just received. The dry treats break apart and become powder instead of chunks. My current jar has nice big chunks with very little powder in the jar while the new jar has much smaller pieces and lots of powder. Both purchased on Amazon. See photos. These treats are not cheap. The same thing happened with the chicken treats I got at the same time but the difference between my last order and my new jar is not as dramatic as with the salmon. Smaller pieces are newest jar.
customer_reviews.author: Christmas-baby

customer_reviews.title: Use to be Great, now not white more grey/yellow and not worth $50/lb
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Halo Chicken Freeze Dried treats for my 10 rescued cats, they were rescued in 2009, they have enjoyed them when they were less then $4, they used to be Pristine White big chunks of chicken, they loved them, now for the last 6-8 months or so they are being shipped with grey pieces ones w black "ribbing" and then yellow like crystalline pieces, they don't eat them and they also ship with a lot of breakage more powder less pieces. The sale price breaks down to about $50 per lb, for chicken so it really should be good chicken to start
customer_reviews.author: guy cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Arrived as dust and I’m thankful!
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately, these liv-a-littles arrived as 50% dust. If my cat had eaten more than the 6 large and 14 small yet intact pieces (at one to three pieces per day over the course of 15 days), he could have died. The disclosed fat content is given as a range and my vet explained that the content of some pieces are too high for an older cat to digest. Additionally, the added carrageenan is not something I should have been feeding my beloved Toonces.
customer_reviews.author: cydrae

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed - Quality declined
customer_reviews.text: Shocking difference, decrease in the quality of the Halo Liv-a Little treats I just received. The dry treats break apart and become instead of chunks. My current jar has nice big chunks with very little powder in the jar while the new jar has much smaller pieces and lots of powder. Both purchased on Amazon. See photos. These treats are not cheap. The same thing happened with the chicken treats I got at the same time but the difference between my last order and my new jar is not as dramatic as with the salmon. Smaller pieces are newest jar.
customer_reviews.author: Christmas-baby

customer_reviews.title: I would like to be compensated. I still love the product
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying halo live a little‘s holistic chicken for my cats for over three years they won’t go to bed without it. But I would like to be able to talk to the people at Halo because something went amok in my last delivery in that one box was 1/3 full. I fully understand that there can be settling in the boxes but this was not settling. There was very little chicken in the container.
customer_reviews.author: lolly

customer_reviews.title: Our old fur baby loves these!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is very finicky in her old age and stopped eating her regular treats. She snubbed her nose at several others that we tried. I found these and decided to give them a try. She loves them! She even prances for them, which she hasn't done in months. I also bought her the chicken version and she loves those, too. We love that they're just freeze dried meat with nothing added so they don't bother her stomach. Will continue to buy as long as she eats them.
customer_reviews.author: VWBugGeek

customer_reviews.title: ::  ::  ::  finicky cats.  ::  ::  ::
customer_reviews.text: My black male cat loves these treats so much he sits by his treat bowl to give me his sexy eyes until I put more treats in his bowl. Salmon are his favorite but he likes the chicken and the beef, too. My Maine Coon female hates them so much she gets offended if she sees them. They are worth trying. If your cats hate them, throw them outside for the birds, they love them. ABOUT THE TEXTURE: these are like soufle which has been dehydrated. They are soft and spongy. If they are too big for your cats they cut easily with scissors or knife.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Ryan

customer_reviews.title: If you set up recurring delivery they don't make it so easy to cancel that
customer_reviews.text: Halo Cat Treats are usually very fresh. This last batch of four containers I received were obviously stale or old. The chicken pieces were difficult or impossible to break for small enough pieces for my cats. I have been throwing away, many pieces that are just too stale. I realize this is a freeze dried product but the pieces are grey and shrunken. This is suppose to be chicken Breast being more a White color. AMAZON, if anyone reads this,, please check your supply and discard the old containers and order fresh from Halo! So be fore warned. And P.S. If you set up recurring delivery they don't make it so easy to cancel that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Mazur

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Treats
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest treat I can give my cats. They are so excited when they see the box. This is a small portion, so I've made it last. Great ingredients and cat approved. These are dried pieces of chicken which means they can be powdery. The cats like the crunch of the chicken pieces as they crumble onto the floor. I'd recommend feeding these treats in a place that is easily swept as they will fall into smaller and smaller pieces, something the cats seem to enjoy. I purchased this treat as the place I adopted my cat fed them to their foster cats and they all seemed to love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeny Kc

customer_reviews.title: Great for picky cats
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product several times to (successfully) entice sick cats to start eating again. We have a few senior citizen cats plus some kittens who had a health care recently. If I break it up in my hands and put it over their wet food, all the cats go crazy for it. I'd suggest that if you have a cat with liver issues, kidney disease, etc. Not a guarantee, but worth a try. My cats will come screaming if they eat me unscrew the lid off this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Messy and expensive
customer_reviews.text: It's a very small container so I don't think it's worth the price. I would much rather buy the bag of freeze dried cat food and use it as treats instead. The container had a few big chunks of the chicken but a lot of it was disintegrated. That made it hard to use as treats because it would get all over my hands and floor and leave a residue.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Really Pricey And Item Really Small
customer_reviews.text: Had this a long time ago.. when i ordered it was way, way, way smaller than i thought it would be, but the cats i used to have enjoyed them.. which was a friendly stray cat and my own pet cat.. they are dead now cause neighbors poisoned them sadly, anyway the item was nice but way, way, way smaller than expected and was quite pricey.. and most of it was chicken dust than the actual chicken pieces. The product didn't stink it smelt ok and animals enjoyed it.. but size for the price wasn't ok so... its a no for me! not gonna get this again, better to buy some treats at walmart it would probably be way cheaper..
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Black thing on it
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I’m unable to update picture, this product is my cat’s favorite snake. However, this time my Chicken comes with a small black thing on one of the dry chicken. I am glad I notice that and open it too see. I can’t tell what is it but I’m depressed of that. It might be bug or something else.... I don’t know if I can keep feed him this box or thrown all away.
customer_reviews.author: olivia

customer_reviews.title: Most kitties LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: My kitties that have tried this absolutely love it! The issue is getting them to try it. It does not have a pungent smell, so many of my cats sniff it and walk on by. Which is wonderful for the cats that HAVE tried it because they run over and eat the treat on the floor! It is expensive (relatively speaking) so it is not an everyday all day treat. But when they see me open the jar they come running!
customer_reviews.author: Etiz

customer_reviews.title: My Cat's Most Favorite Brand
customer_reviews.text: This brand is a little expensive, but the term "you get what you pay for" is SO TRUE! Other brands of freeze dried chicken breast treats can have a weird smell, and I am not feeding anything to my cat or dog that smells bad. These morsels, are soft and that is what my cat likes. They aren't hard and rough to chew. I got a great deal buying Halo through Amazon, knowing that pet shops up the price a lot .
customer_reviews.author: Kattballoo

customer_reviews.title: Hlao Chicken Treats are loved by all cats I've had
customer_reviews.text: Cats love these treats. The downside, they cause really bad constipation in cats. I have to really watch how much I give my cats because the product is so dry that it is hard for the cat to get enough water to compensate. This may not be as much of a problem for cats that eat wet food, but if you have a dry food addict, this may be enough to stop things up. I actually give my cats some coconut oil and that seems to keep things moving along rather nicely.
customer_reviews.author: T. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Great for my cat's sensitive stomach
customer_reviews.text: My 10 yr old sweet ragdoll cat has the most sensitive stomach ever. She loves these treats! No vomiting or diarrhea either. I love that they are both dog and cat friendly, my pup gets jealous and can enjoy these treats too! I wish the container was a bit bigger, the price is high for these but overall I am so glad that my cat's stomach can tolerate these.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Best, healthy treat for kitties &
customer_reviews.text: The only thing my cat goes Ga-Ga for. He can be in a sound sleep, and I even move the container, he's right there! Being protective of his health, I called the Halo company, (as there is a simaliar product that contains ASH,) and was satisfied that this is only freeze dried chicken - period. I even tasted it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah H.

customer_reviews.title: What happened??
customer_reviews.text: I have these on auto-order but may be canceling if I keep receiving containers that are half full of rock-hard treats. These always used to be so fresh and now I'm worried my cat will break a tooth. I have to sift through them and pull out the softer pieces. What happened? This brand used to be so reliable and my cat does love them. Quality control needs to be improved (used to be at a high standard). Very disappointed in what we've been receiving lately. (Chicken, in particular).
customer_reviews.author: M. Chesney

customer_reviews.title: This should be great....
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my cats. Simple freeze dried chicken... the price is high, in my opinion for such a small amount. However, it doesn’t matter because my cats will not eat this!? I couldn’t even tell ya’ll why... I thought for sure it’d be a hit. My cats eat cooked chicken. Blended chicken. Just not freeze dried! My dogs think everything is amazing and yummy so I can’t rely on an honest opinion from them. They are gluttons. Good luck...
customer_reviews.author: H.W.

customer_reviews.title: Cats can't resist!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these! Crucial for cats and small dogs to break the larger pieces down like they say on the packaging because my female stuck her paw in and grabbed out a chunk while I was treating my male and she gagged on it! I really appreciate that these are in containers because my female also shreds treat bags, which she takes out of the cupboards, that I now have to put baby locks on lol!
customer_reviews.author: guidokatt13

customer_reviews.title: Sick cat loved them
customer_reviews.text: I love that the ingredient list is tiny and they're pure protein, My cat loved these like mad but ended up allergic to Salmon. He was being super picky about food and treats because he was on chemo treatment but these he still would have eaten if they didn't make him itch like mad. Neighbor's cat loved them too. Bought them because they were pure protein and I wanted him to eat as well as possible.
customer_reviews.author: K.A.

customer_reviews.title: Happy cats!
customer_reviews.text: My cats just love this product. Some of the pieces are too hard for them to chew, so I put it in the blender and turn the whole thing into powder. It’s known around here as either “Happy Powder” or “Kitty Crack”. If any of the cats get picky (we have three ) I just sprinkle some on the food and it’s eaten with no problem. Won’t be without it!
customer_reviews.author: D. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Why did you add fillers and salt when this was pure before
customer_reviews.text: Biggest pet peeve- no pun intended- is when a company takes a clean food product and changes it without notice. Adds all kinds of fillers, salt and unnecessary ingredients. Just noticed after buying 4 more and am throwing them out. Bummed for the waste of money. My dog loves the taste but it's horrible for him and his digestion. Don't buy this or other products with fillers and salt and pointless additions. I'd appreciate a refund but can't find seller info anywhere. thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Product has changed; Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Not the same product as before. My recent pack of 6 containers have grayish-yello pieces, hard. They used to be white, easy to break in half, and tender. My cat is not amused with these. They are obviously not tasty and practically breaks my cats teeth to eat! What happened that this product has changed so dramatically?
customer_reviews.author: JeanneB

customer_reviews.title: Vital cat is a better freeze dried brand of cat treats.
customer_reviews.text: Vital comes in better packaging. It actually looks like chicken pieces not these gross cubes. And looking at more of this Halo company I am not impressed. They are SNAKE OIL salesmen. Dogs and cats should NOT be going vegan or vegetarian. That is Animal Cruelty and just dumb.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great until the price doubled
customer_reviews.text: My cats love them. They’re great in that they are whole chunks without the skin they hate & come on a great jar that keeps them from become powder in the delivery process. However, the price has doubled since my last shipment & I can bring myself to spend that much on treats for my cats...as much as I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Cmats

customer_reviews.title: Not the amount advertised on jar.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this for my sisters dog many times, most often there is powder and small chunks of dried chicken that settle in the jar. My sister called to say the jar was barely 1/3 third full, it had its seal still intact, so it was not tampered with. I paid the same as before for 1/3 amount. These are expensive treats, you should get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Treats cats love!
customer_reviews.text: In the past I ordered freeze dried chicken- different brand in a bag, but my finicky kitty loves these more! Who knew there could be a difference! I sprinkle on wet food and also set a couple pieces on a plate for her ... she will move it to a different place and devour it like a kill!
customer_reviews.author: GoodBetterBest

customer_reviews.title: Old dog loves these!
customer_reviews.text: Great for our finicky old dog. Bought her the salmon ones, too, and she loves them. She even prances for her treats, and she hasn't done that in several months. We love that they're just freeze dried meat with nothing else, so they don't bother her stomach. Will continue to buy them as long as she eats them.
customer_reviews.author: VWBugGeek

customer_reviews.title: Great for Doberman's Coat
customer_reviews.text: My son and I went rouind and round about his doberman's coat being dry and sparse for years. He finally agreed to let me get these for the dog and his smart, new girlfriend started giving him these as directed. After about a month she texted me and said its amazing how shiny and thick the dobie's coat was and that even my son admitted it to her that the dobie looks great. Thank you we will purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: gibbs52

customer_reviews.title: Another great Halo product
customer_reviews.text: Our dog goes nuts over this freeze dried chicken breast. While it is admittedly pricey, we have confidence that the treat, itself is good for our dog. All we have to do is shake the container and she's ready to do all the tricks she knows in order to get a small piece. Great product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: scout1968

customer_reviews.title: Cat treat
customer_reviews.text: This is a treat for pets. I can't comment on the flavor, but my cat likes it a lot. It is pricey, but something that brings her front and center when I need her is worth it. She won't even sniff at most cat treats. She does come when called sometimes. I call "chicken".
customer_reviews.author: Judith Schiebout

customer_reviews.title: Carrageenan is a no-no for IBD
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kitties who "kind of" like these. Gave them to my mom's kitties and got mixed results. Unfortunately for us, I didn't read the ingredient label before I purchased it, and later realized it isn't just straight chicken- old kitty can't have salt and just as importantly, the product contains carrageenan which has been shown to upset kitties with IBD. We did also buy the salmon treats which are just straight salmon and got mixed results.
customer_reviews.author: Against the grain

customer_reviews.title: We call this "kitty crack" . . .
customer_reviews.text: Although we buy it primarily for our three cats, every single animal in our household LOVES these treats. We call this "kitty crack" just because that's how our critters act when they're offered a piece! Just one piece, and they're addicted. It's somewhat pricey for our budget -- retired, living on a fixed income -- but it's worth buying to give our four-legged children an occasional treat. I say "occasional" simply because we have six: three dogs, Max, Mischief, and Dammit; then three cats, Pounce de Leon, Willie Nelson, and Phineas MacDougall, and they all act as if they've never had anything even half as good as these treats.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Not the Same Quality
customer_reviews.text: My cats have enjoyed these treats for the past two years, but this product is no longer the same quality. There is also now a disclaimer stating freeze dried product must be refrigerated. This is not the case with human dehydrated food??? This treat now gives my cats diarrhea. Like other reviewers have said, you get mostly powder and the quality and ingredients are questionable. Sad. My cats will miss this treat.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H.

customer_reviews.title: Sort carefully.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these. I like givingbbher real food. I take the time to sift out all dust and transfer to a treat jar. While doing that this time I found a small piece of plastic. Be aware and pay attention as you dole out these.
customer_reviews.author: Dargriff

customer_reviews.title: These treats are tiny brown pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these Halo treats for years and have been pleased with them. In the past the treats have been large white pieces. There were a few treats in this jar that were one third as large as they used to be. The rest were half as large as my finger nail and they were brown. Why are they brown? I am afraid to give them to my Cat!!! I am very disappointed and Angry!!!
customer_reviews.author: mary jo humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Many pieces are hard and even cats can't chew them
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product really deteriorated. Previously, most of the pieces would be dry but soft to touch and easily chewed on and eaten by my cats. I would from time to time encounter one or two hard ones. But now it is more than a half of pieces that are not usable. The product is not cheap. I think they over bake it or something. But it is unacceptable quality the way it is now.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Weller

customer_reviews.title: Watch the price, for amt. you get
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is wonderful and 2 of my furbabies love them. BUT.. I ran into a problem with pricing of amount you get. I ordered the one that said, you got 12 per case. I knew it was a long shot, but I ordered anyway. I wasn't really surprised that I only got one container for 15 bucks, but was pretty disappointed, that I had paid that much for the signal item. At my surprise, I did receive a refund, for the false advertisement . I was pleased with that. Thank you Amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: C. McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought probably six bags of different treats for my cat. He did not care for any of them. These have always been a big hit in our house with our dog and cat. My car does not listen but if we need him inside we just shake the box and he’ll come!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Not for us, but also not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Let’s be honest, as a human I have no idea what the flavor is like. I got these with a bag of Halo food as kind of a buy this and try this situation... for starters they smell like the flakes you feed goldfish, and while my cats are in love with them I had to stop giving them to them because they have a hard time with them mainly due to the whole very freeze dried zero moisture. Again, the cats loved them, I am just scared every time I give my cats one that something is going to happen and they’ll choke or there will be a bone in there
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Say: "Best. Treats. Ever!"
customer_reviews.text: My cats & dog go bonkers for these treats! I keep them in the fridge and whenever I open the door, they all run over and stare at me waiting for a treat. They all follow me and meow for their favorite treat - I've never seen such a reaction with any other treat! A great healthy snack for your kitties. A tip when feeding - only feed kitties a few small pieces during each treat session. Because these treats are freeze-dried, eating too many at once can cause your cat to have trouble swallowing/digesting them and throw up.
customer_reviews.author: Ecco 0306

customer_reviews.title: My pups love it and its USA made healthy.
customer_reviews.text: Only treats I give now. Hard to trust puppy food after my chihuahua became sick. She ate royal canine chihuahua and several types of expensive treats. All of which is made in China. Yes royal canine china. My girl had liver issues. Now she is getting better and lover her new food. No more vomiting and is excited to est her dry dog food.
customer_reviews.author: s bruner

customer_reviews.title: Boss cat approves
customer_reviews.text: My bossy cat really likes these freeze dried treats. I wasn't sure he would, but wanted to try something new for him. My only negative comment would be how much flakes off into powdery consistency which I may try sprinkling on his food. Hopefully he'll eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats with sensitive stomach....
customer_reviews.text: Cats love it. I’m happy. Good job. Will definitely reorder. Two out four cats have very sensitive stomach and the other treats just gave them the runs. This works for all. A++++++++++++++ product. Keep up the great work.
customer_reviews.author: Swimmer MOM

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these!
customer_reviews.text: ...and I love the fact that these are made from pure salmon. A perfect treat! I’m having difficulty finding this product in local pet stores and have heard that the company is discontinuing it? Really? Just in case it’s true I bought several boxes on Amazon - please keep making this excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: patricianyc

customer_reviews.title: My pup LOVES these.... of course they smell 🤢
customer_reviews.text: Smells like raw fish, which I find disgusting & have to hold my breath as soon as I open the jar BUT my pup LOVES these!!! The sizes are varied which is fine because I can choose which size to grab for a pre-meal treat or just for snacking. It's all natural & doesn't seem to disrupt her digestion. I do NOT give these everyday.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great - but now smells bad
customer_reviews.text: My cats won't eat them anymore. They used to love it. So I smelled the new batch and it smelt horrible. No wonder the cats don't want it anymore. Something has changed or this is an amazon product that is not real.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Dodge

customer_reviews.title: GREAT healthy and tasty treat for cats
customer_reviews.text: My cat CANNOT WAIT for these treats. Freeze drying (preserved by rapidly freezing it and then subjecting it to a high vacuum that removes ice by sublimation.) done correctly is a wonderful way to preserve the flavor, texture and nutrients. My cat is a finicky eater and she loves this. Hint: The excess powder - I add water to rehydrate some of the small pieces, and by adding water, I turn it into a paste which she loves too. (I tried adding it to other foods for flavor but it didn't work. My cat wouldn't touch it.)
customer_reviews.author: Fallen Angel 5193

customer_reviews.title: Both my dogs and my cat love those treats
customer_reviews.text: My picky cat cannot get enough of those and i cannot believe it. Also, my dogs love them but that was not as surprising. The only problem is that there us too much dust in there and the contents of the boxes are inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Ivelina Ivanova

customer_reviews.title: She's a fiend for these
customer_reviews.text: One of my three cats LOVEs these so much she freaks out every night starting about an hour before I dish out the nightly treats. She paces by the pantry and mows really loud. As soon as she sees me put the treats out for her, she RUNs over and gobbles them up. Now she only wants these treats. Nothing else is good enough for her...cats! I am so fearful that I might run out of these one day. I can't imagine how she would survive it. My other two cats won't touch these, but they are super picky, so I don't blame the treats.
customer_reviews.author: Scoli

customer_reviews.title: Twice the cost of the Chicken Treat flavor
customer_reviews.text: My cats would sell their other lives for these treats. If you are attempting to train your cats or just want to give them a healthily treat- this is orth the money. I have written a review on this stuff before. The salmon is twice as expensive as the chicken. My cats prefer the chicken, but I get the occasional salmon just for variety. This also must be REFRIGERATED. Also, some of the treats are too large and should be broken up. The salmon doesn't break well, so I used kitchen scissors to dive them down. There's always some crumbs or powder left in the container with I'll sprinkle on their dry food to make more interesting.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Cats love these. Real chicken.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these treats. Excellent for training. The cats know the sound of shaking the container and come running. These are real chicken, freeze dried. Cats need just a little, so they last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: I. Hepler

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality despite hefty $ increase
customer_reviews.text: My Ragdoll loved this product until recently. Now most of the package contains pieces that appear to be inedible. I am unable to even break them and she actually spits these out..... Very disappointing especially experiencing the recent 40% price increase. If it’s garbage, please don’t expect me to continue to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KMinBurbank

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BOTHER BUYING
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes to give my cats whole chicken that I didn't have to cook. Unfortunately my two male cats sniffed it and walked away, leaving the chicken parts uneaten. I tried and tried to entice them....but they know what they like and don't like. Maybe your cats might like it! But mine didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Norma

customer_reviews.title: Cat LOVES these
customer_reviews.text: Our cat goes nuts for these, we have to hide them in the pantry and shut the door or he will drag them out and push them across the floor until we give him one. Seem to be healthy -- we sprinkle a little water on them in a bowl to soften.
customer_reviews.author: K80

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this product because my 2 Pomeranians love it. The product description is completely wrong
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this a negative review I would. I ordered this product because my 2 Pomeranians love it. The product description is completely wrong. I looked at this and saw it was for a case which is a great price. I tend to wait and buy this at petsmart when it’s buy one get one. This is a great product unfortunately this supplier is swindling people with an inaccurate description. You get one container of the salmon treats not a case! I’m very dissatisfied and disappointed. I am Not even able to return the item or placeca replacement request.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Reamer

customer_reviews.title: Large portions of white meat chicken, my cats love these.
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews was hesitant to order these, but my cats loved them when I bought them from a local store. Went ahead and ordered 3 jars, and so glad I did. Big whole chunks of chicken in all 3 containers, yes some crumbs in the bottom but not much. These treats have been a big help getting my older kitty to eat her regular kibble. Only reason for 4 stars is I would love if these were free of preservatives like they used to be.
customer_reviews.author: MikiMouse

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES these treats!
customer_reviews.text: My cat screams for this treat every morning after breakfast and every night after dinner. It is a ritual for him. If I don't have these treats on hand, my cat is depressed. These treats are for both cats and dogs. It is pricey, and I have tried alternatives that I can get at local large chain pet stores, but I cannot fool my cat. He won't touch anything but these treats.
customer_reviews.author: AnimalLover

customer_reviews.title: Cats love the taste but it's mostly waste
customer_reviews.text: Pros: All of my cats love these and would gobble as much as I would give them. Cons: They are very expensive for a small amount, and lately the package arrives with what is mostly fine powder instead of chunks - at least half of the amount is useless! Not worth the money and I will try to find something better.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Santone

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Darcy Using Cat Code?
customer_reviews.text: For some reason my cat does not care too much for these treats. I get them for Mr. Darcy because of their high protein content which most supermarket kitty treats do not have. I will add, however, that even though he appears bored when I present them to him, by morning I notice he has consumed several that I placed in his snack dish. So maybe he's just behaving finecky as part of Cat Code. After all, in popular culture, Bro Code is etiquette for males to follow so I think my kitty cat may just be showing loyalty to his species.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Donahue

customer_reviews.title: My Persian loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My Persian loves these! Anyone can be her BFF for life if they give her one of these. It is good to have a "go to" treat like this for when I want my kittycat to come to me. All I do is rattle the box and presto! Like magic,she appears.
customer_reviews.author: In California

customer_reviews.title: Only get ONE.
customer_reviews.text: These are great but they are not a pack of 6!!!! You only get one for $12 which is a rip off because you can buy them on Amazon one at $7. THIS AD IS WRONG!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Pets like them
customer_reviews.text: Both the cats and the dog like these treats. Soft so the dog with few teeth can eat easily. 3 stars for flavor because I don't know how they taste. They know what is being offered as soon as I open the jar.
customer_reviews.author: KAREN  MESSICK

customer_reviews.title: Price Too High
customer_reviews.text: This product gets 3 stars because it's a huge hit. My dog and cats all love these treats SO much. They know the sound of the lid. Very enjoyable. However, the pieces come powdered and broken, and the cost has raised past the point of "worth it". It isn't a large jar. It doesn't last long. I understand intelligent costs have gone up and it's "premium", but this is astronomical considering it's JUST chicken and how much the price has gone up.
customer_reviews.author: Jen AZ

customer_reviews.title: Major hit with my pets!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this product says it is for cats AND dogs, so I was intrigued. What I didn't realize was that it was freeze-dried salmon, which is why ALL my animals went nuts for it - duh! My schnauzer loved them, but ended up with diarrhea, so no more for her. But my two cats, wow, they ate them like crazy...I had to give them a couple right away, but they will nearly bite your finger off if you don't wash your hands after handling the snacks! I love that this has one ingredient only, so thanks for that!! It was a huge hit for all the pets in the house, cats and dog alike!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M

customer_reviews.title: Peka Love it
customer_reviews.text: My puppy Peka love it very much. The only way for me to get her inside is use this treats. She love it, as soon as she hear me unscrewing the top she ran in and sit right in front of me waiting for the treats. If I use other treats I have to kind of treat Peka to get inside. But with Halo Liv-A-Littles all salmon she love it.
customer_reviews.author: Yernificent1998

customer_reviews.title: Mostly crumbs, but dog enjoyed it
customer_reviews.text: If I didn't receive over half a container of crumbs, this would've been an awesome product. It didn't have that strong liver smell and my dog loved it. But feeding him powder instead of pieces was rather gross. :) I ended up pouring some powder over his food as a little treat. I don't know how the company could repackage to avoid this, but I hope they consider it.
customer_reviews.author: kehauwTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My Persian cat loves these big pieces
customer_reviews.text: My Persian cat loves these. The pieces are big and there aren't all those little "shreds" that other much cheaper brands include. I use them as a special treat for her. For only one item, $15 is too much. I thought I was getting a case of 12 because that's what it said. I only received one, and Amazon gave me a refund so that's all good.
customer_reviews.author: In California

customer_reviews.title: Our senior dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our picky senior diabetic dog (15 3/4 years) old endorses this product and if he had opposable thumbs he would probably eat it in one sitting. I like that it is natural and has no grain products added, so he can safely eat it as a diabetic. Thanks for making this product that’s soft for him to eat and nutritious for a diabetic.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Would've been awesome under better circumstances
customer_reviews.text: I love that the ingredient list is tiny and they're pure protein, I just couldn't get my cat to eat them. I lost him to cancer so it's possible his taste buds weren't reliable being on chemo. Neighbor's cat loved them. Bought them because they were pure protein and I wanted him to eat as well as possible. If he would eat them (not Halo's fault) they would have been worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: K.A.

customer_reviews.title: Gobbles as if candy, yet very healthy
customer_reviews.text: Once my small dog realized they didn’t need a scent to have a meat flavor she foibles them as if they were candy. I appreciate ho healthy, and lightweight they are.
customer_reviews.author: Aaahs

customer_reviews.title: My three cats love them!
customer_reviews.text: Though I had learned that these taste terrible to humans (pop -in-law was raiding our snacks and thought these were people food) they apprently are yummy for cats! I only took off one star becuase sometimes the pieces are broken up very small and they like the big pieces they can crunch better.
customer_reviews.author: Salt

customer_reviews.title: ... all 3 cats (one of them a kitten) absolutely LOVE!! I'm grateful to find something HEALTHY but ...
customer_reviews.text: jut received this morning and all 3 cats (one of them a kitten) absolutely LOVE!! I'm grateful to find something HEALTHY but the price is a bit staggering... UGH. I would really love to freeze dry & make my own since I feed raw & want the best for my "kiddos", but all the research I've done has proven that it is a VERY expensive undertaking..OY!." That said, I think for now I'll just dehydrate chicken in my convection oven for treats. This stuff is great but just too $$$ for my pocketbook. I still give it a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: ensign4Him

customer_reviews.title: Price doubled
customer_reviews.text: Had these on subscription for around 8 bucks. Amazon stopped teh subscription, and now they're twice the price. The cats love them, but unless you're rich, I wouldnt purchase. Once cat goes thru the container in 3 weeks (4 pieces a day)
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Consistency
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product is inconsistent. Sometimes my cat doesn't like the flavor of a new package. Other times she can't get enough treats. The answer I received with regards to the seaweed extract is inconsistent with the information available on the public domain. It can cause intestinal inflation in cats. I asked if their product was cat tested. No answer!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dennen

customer_reviews.title: One if the awesomest treats for cats. But beware ...
customer_reviews.text: One if the awesomest treats for cats. But beware, you will not be able to sleep until you give these tasty treats at least once a day....Or night in our case. However I've been able to use them to teach tricks such as sit and high five. Problem is the package is never big enough. :-/ I've also learned not to leave the container down low as it has been found all over the house with teeth marks in it.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: they were so stale that my cat couldn't eat them, I couldn't even break them
customer_reviews.text: I have been having trouble getting fresh Liv-a-littles for a while. I contacted the company and they said they were aware of the problem. That was 4 or 5 months ago. I am a bit wetted because my cat loves them and cries when he doesn't have them. The cost is irrelevant when they are fresh but a big waste of money this time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves them, but hard as a rock lately
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these and I have them auto delivered every month. I have noticed lately that some of pieces are hard as a rock. I crumble them on top of her food as a treat, but have had to throw some away.
customer_reviews.author: CLGSF

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats are crazy for these treats. Its so fun. I shake the bottle and they come running. I use it to get them back inside from my apartment patio. They are indoor kitties, but they love sitting out on the patio. They could eat the whole box at once if I let them. I give 3 or 4 and they love these. I do not recommend the chicken flavor because it has a bad ingredient in it, carrageenan. But the salmon and beef don't have it so its safe ingredients!
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Dodge

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these.
customer_reviews.text: What I think doesn't matter. What My cat thinks is all that matters, and she really loves Halo Freeze dried treats. Her favorites are the Salmon and also the Chicken Breast.
customer_reviews.author: Trailrider

customer_reviews.title: Weird af
customer_reviews.text: These look mega sketchy. Super powdery (its chicken?!) and texture is weird. I keep telling myself its because its freeze dried but honestly i have a hard time giving it to my dog because it looks so suspect.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey

customer_reviews.title: Kitties love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I can only speak for the kitties whom the treats were given to. They absolutely love it. We first learned about it from people we pet sit for. They call it kitty crack because they love it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Kristeen Adams

customer_reviews.title: It is good for her
customer_reviews.text: My cat really loves this. It is good for her. Other people complain that it crushes to powder- Well what do you expect -IT"S FREEZE DRIED!! Just add little to rehydrate those smaller pieces so it will not be wasted and the cat will like it too.
customer_reviews.author: farah sumcad

customer_reviews.title: My dog loved it sprinkled on his wet food
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats sprinkled on his wet food. I had this product on automatic delivery each month cause the price was reasonable. But this month it went up $2.00 from $7,99 to $9,99. A bit too expensive for a monthly purchase. If the price goes back down I will reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs. One is a great dane and the other is a small dog. This isn't enough for a large dog. But, perfect for a small dog.
customer_reviews.author: K12R

customer_reviews.title: Animals Love These
customer_reviews.text: My cats and dog really love these. The cats go crazy as soon as I pick up the jar. The container is smaller than I realized. It’s my own fault for not paying attention to the oz, which is very clearly listed. Because of that, these are a bit pricey and I only give it to the pets as a special treat.
customer_reviews.author: M. WalkerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A great treat for my feline companion!
customer_reviews.text: Part of me wishes I never gave these to my cat! He doesn’t want any other treat. Given a cat’s typical lifetime, I’ll be buying these for the next 17 years!
customer_reviews.author: H. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Kitty-crack I encourage my cat to eat!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cat/dog treat on the market. 100% fish and nothing else. Sadly it keeps going out of stock, just as the living creatures it is made from are disappearing from the wild. :(
customer_reviews.author: Stacey mowchan

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves them
customer_reviews.text: My cat is addicted to treats. We mix regular cat food in with the treats and she doesn't even notice, got these treats and it was hard to get her to try them but she went mad with the first bite. Miss Picky loves them. We will buy more
customer_reviews.author: CrabbyChick

customer_reviews.title: Cats love them!
customer_reviews.text: Great to add dry to food or just as a snack. Cats love these. These have become a go to for our fat..ahem...I mean fluffy felines. Healthier than those old cheapy store brands.
customer_reviews.author: Anonny Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Our bengal loves these
customer_reviews.text: He will suffer indignities for these treats that the normal treats will not coax him into. Want his full attention? Move the box slightly, and he'll notice from six miles away in a hurricane.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew V.

customer_reviews.title: Our feral cat loves!
customer_reviews.text: Hey we have a feral cat on our property and he absolutely love these. He comes to the porch each day for this treat.
customer_reviews.author: Orgainc mama-san

customer_reviews.title: best treat for my cats
customer_reviews.text: my cats really love it! It's the best treat I've ever fed cats. It's been 10 years since I fed this product. My cat never rejects this product.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product and my cats LOVE them!
customer_reviews.text: My cats go crazy over these treats! I love the fact that they are made from Chicken Breast, are FREEZE DRIED and not dehydrated and they are made in the U.S. My daughter’s two cats and Bernese Mountain dog also love them. I eat healthy products and I want my cats to eat healthfully also.
customer_reviews.author: KathyK

customer_reviews.title: My cat is picky
customer_reviews.text: I don't think it's the product, my cat is really picky. She didn't like it at all. I gave it to my friend, her cat ate it. I guess it depends on the cat.
customer_reviews.author: TimiZora

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these more than life itself
customer_reviews.text: My cat begs for these and knows them by name! She licks the inside for every morsel and uses her paw to get a treat out of the jar.. She even cries everyday aski g for them soon after we are out. Our new kitten is following in Ricky's footsteps!
customer_reviews.author: Kat's Personal Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cat didn’t realized they’re food.
customer_reviews.text: My two cats sniffed and walked away. They didn’t think it’s food or smell like food. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat love
customer_reviews.text: My 3 cats are extremely picky. They love them. When shipped crumbs are noticeable on bottom. On occasion there are several hard pieces, which I throw out. All in all great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dede

product_meta.title: Halo Liv-A-Littles Grain Free Freeze Dried Natural Dog & Cat Treats
product_meta.description:
Flavor Name:Freeze Dried Chicken BreastHalo uses real WHOLE meat, poultry, or fish, and NO "meat meal" of ANY kind in our natural dog treats and cat treats. LIV-A-LITTLES Freeze Dried Chicken Protein Treats let you reward your pet with the taste and benefits of a high protein snack. These freeze dried dog treats and cat treats can be given whole or easily crumbled and added to food as a tasty incentive at mealtime. If you feed your dog freeze dried liver treats, try Halo’s freeze dried dog treats. Halo’s highly digestible natural dog treats and cat treats are made of the finest quality ingredients for a happy pet—inside and out.

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Tasty pieces of freeze dried chicken
Grain free single protein treats; a low calorie reward
Pets love these natural dog treats and cat treats
Freeze dried dog treats and cat treats in a portable easy to seal jar that keeps them fresh
Halo supports ranchers and farmers who say "yes" to responsible animal husbandry and "no" to the use of GMO feeds, and sources wild caught seafood from sustainable fisheries.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
